author: Rahul Baid
text: 'Good food!'

author: Ivo Pletikosić
text: "Loved their General Tso's chicken
column5: beef curry
column6: red curry soup. Wasn't impressed with other chicken dishes
column7: seems like they cook vegetables and chicken separately and mix them for you before serving so they all taste the same."

author: ankita biswas
text: 'I ordered Mee goreng and mango sticky rice through Grubhub. The shrimps in the mee goreng were super chewy and the mangoes were raw. Wouldn’t recommend at all.'

author: R Y
text: 'I let my Singaporean wife order everything we had here
column5: and every single dish was extremely satisfying. I especially loved the Mee Goreng (Indian style.) Decent food portions
column6: decent-looking tab (10% cash discount applied) at the end of the evening.'

author: gammeelovemusic
text: 'Recommend the fries flat noodle and coconut pudding! Pho is just so so.'

author: Christie Rose Vitucci
text: 'The food here is very authentic hands down one of my favorite spots for some Malaysian/Cantonese items. My favorite dish is the coconut lamb sooo good. Would definitely recommend. 5 stars for sure.'

author: Sonia Siaw
text: 'Love the Malaysian food cooked and served at Satay. Ordered the Terengganu Chicken and it was full of flavored. Chicken rice is delicious!'

author: Andrew G
text: "This is a mainstay for us
column5: but it's only because we know the (crazily large and redundant) menu. GOOD: roti canai
column6: veggie spring rolls
column8: most basic noodle dishes (Mei Fun Country Style
column10: some of their soups. BAD: pad thai
column12: mango noodle (really stay away from these three!)
column14: and some of the standard Chinese dishes are really bland. The Malaysian menu overall is not bad and worth a shot."

author: Doug Keeton
text: 'Great Malaysian food
column5: Malaysian specialty soups are especially good.'

author: Mony Kiem
text: 'You’d have to pay me to eat here again.\n\nThe pad thai is probably the worst I’ve ever had. It was bland and flavorless. It had the same flavor as white rice
column5: which is to say none. I kept taking bite after bite hoping that some flavor to surface
column6:
but my efforts were in vain.

I also had the beef Chen’s mai dish which was also bland. Not as bland as the pad Thai but almost the same. I requested it to be spicy and there was none. At least the beef was tender.

The irony of it all? The white rice (hainanese) which was included as part of the beef dish was the star of the show. It was perfectly cooked with perfect grains. If not for this rice
column7: I’d probably give this place a 1.'

author: Ed Wiegner
text: "Satay
column5: Asia's Restaurant
column6:
Great Food!
The freshness of the food here is Amazing.
Service is extraordinary.
Prices are very reasonable"

author: Peter Yong (PedroJoven)
text: 'Authentic taste of Malaysian food. Beef rendang was tender
column5: had good curry and not too spicy
column6: lobak was decent
column8: kangkung belacan has real shrimp paste
column9: chili sauce chicken rice was better than Nyonya in  NYC
column10: roti canai and satay was on the dot. As a Malaysian

author: Regina Jaslow
text: 'Tasty and authentic dishes including roti prata
column5: Hainanese chicken rice
column6: prawn mee

author: mihika gupta
text: 'The roti kanoi was good ! Overall food was fresh and taste was nice . The green Thai curry was inexplicably expensive though'

author: Jason Jaslow
text: 'Authentic and delicious SE Asian food. As the spouse of a Singaporean
column5: we enjoy going there for a taste of home.'

author: Shareen Fatima
text: 'It’s a fairly nice place to enjoy Malay/Thai food. I especially loved their lichi drink. It was quite refreshing. Their veg green curry was $17 and it felt a bit pricy since their meat options were for the same price if not low.\nGiving them a 3.5 star rating because we were a group of 3 and our server billed the gratuity in advance on our check
column5: would have made sense if we were larger group but she shouldn’t have charged it upfront.'

author: Cecilia Chung
text: "Affordable lunch deals ($8.95) and 10%off if you pay with cash. Deal includes soup
column5: with 3 options to choose from. We tried the egg drop and the curry and they were tasty. Curry one is slightly spicy. For mains we got malaysian fried noodle and curry fried rice. Noodles were excellent and with 5 shrimps. Fried rice also delicious and fresh
column6: comes with chicken. Mild but I'd say slightly spicy.\nThey also have drinks and appetizers I want to try next!"

author: Ted Lee
text: 'Doesn’t taste anything like padthai.'

author: Muhammad Ahmad
text: 'Great authentic Malaysia food.'

author: Elena Nik
text: 'Food is ok. Lunch portions is too small.'

author: Mariana Noriega
text: 'Amazing every time'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'always great tasting and delicious food
column5: roti canai is the best'

author: Rob Naked Cowboy
text: 'Too salty.'

author: MrRuAli
text: 'Coconut pudding gave food poisoning. Food was bland and tasteless. Never again!'

author: Cherlynn Low
text: 'The indoor dining experience is.. fine but the food is good 👌'

author: Richika Saraf
text: 'Always love this place. Their Roti Canai
column5: veg Chili chicken (made from soy) and coconut pudding are absolutely finger licking good.'

author: Jeannette Calle
text: 'The General Tao chicken is the best in town
column5: so is the beef chow fun. My only go too in Hoboken for great Chinese.'

author: Brendan McCann
text: 'This was phenomenal. Reasonable prices
column5: great food
column6: and eveyone was polite and professional.'

author: Lantian Zhang
text: 'Good Malaysian food. The coconut pudding is great. You can order directly at their website with 10% off instead of from other delivery services.'

author: Abdullah Zubair
text: 'Great Vegetarian options!'

author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great food and service'

author: Mike Saini
text: 'Our original waiter was very rude
column5: my friend and I both noticed it. Very condescending. Roti Canai was great but the Beef Chowmein was kind of nasty. First time and last time trying out this restaurant.'

author: Bhargava V
text: 'Lovely hole-in-the wall style malaysian  restaurant. The food is finger-licking good! Their Roti Canai
column5: Roti Telur are our favorites and sometimes we go here just to eat just these two dishes.'

author: M Koch
text: "Outstanding location for tasty malaysian food. Got there near seven
column5: it wasn't very crowded. Service is consistently good. Food and feeling reminds me of Kansas City."

author: Stanley O
text: "Fine place for delicious Malaysian food. Arrived at five
column5: it wasn't busy. Prices were fair."

author: Karen N
text: 'Ridiculously good place for Malaysian cuisine if you’re in the area. The roti is delicious
column5: although the curry is slightly more watery than what I’ve had in Malaysia - it still tastes pretty good for what might be a more American spin to the dish. Loved the char kway teow dish - it’s one of the most popular in Malaysia and the shrimp was perfect
column6: not salty at all. Would definitely come back!'

author: Vlad Sobol
text: "Delicious Malaysian food in no frills setting. Quite high on sodium
column5: so I'd indulge occasionally."

author: Praveena Prasad
text: 'À one-time go restaurant for Malaysian cuisine in Hoboken. They had both outdoor and indoor seating(can see open kitchen indoors)
column5: the place was more focussed on takeout&delivery orders. The food was okay-ish
column6: ordered Sambal beef with white rice
column8: Spicy flat noodles and Nasi Goreng Fried rice. The fried rice was too salty and we had to send it back
column10: the beef could have used for flavor
column11: the noodle dishes were alright. The best thing was the Lychee flavored green bubble tea. We were a group of just 4
column12: a gratuity of 15% was already included in the bill(without tips).'

author: Noah20 B
text: 'Malaysian food here - very tasty. Came here on a Friday I think. Definitely worth going back to. The bill was decent for the quality. Food is like a restaurant in Jacksonville I loved.'

author: romita saha
text: 'Very similar to Indian cuisine ... if you like spicy food must try'

author: Harshad Kulkarni
text: 'Love the Roti Canai
column5: it’s the first and ONLY dish I’ve had here. But considering the taste
column6: I am very confident the rest of their food will be same if not better. Looking forward to trying some more options.'

author: Nicolas Boyer
text: 'One of my fav spots for quality Malaysian food. I had a brother come into town and asked me to take him back here. The bill was fair for the quality of food. Food is similar to a cafe in Portland I loved.'

author: Yang Yang
text: 'Ordered from Uber eat. Barely edible.'

author: Mo. M.
text: 'I give 1-star because of the incredibly rude and impolite old lady (owner?) at the cash register. I hope the restaurant will do something about that
column5: I do not want to come back to Satay because of this bitter person. And I was not the only one who noticed her bad attitude. Disappointing.'

author: Aracely Gonzalez
text: 'Delicious food'

author: Angel Frazier
text: "Fine place for malaysian food. i give this spot two thumbs up. i've had nothing but great experiences here and will keep coming back."

author: Laurie May
text: 'Excellent food. Spicy but yummy.  Too bad I live clear across the country in Utah because this would be my new favorite place!!  Thank you for an awesome meal.'

author: Holly W
text: 'Food was great
column5: as was the service. Highly recommend this restaurant to all.'

author: Benjamin Atwater
text: 'I placed an order online
column5: and received order confirmation that the food was coming within 15 minutes. So I trekked out in the rain to make the pickup time. When I asked about my order the staff could not find it then picked up an order sheet under other papers putting it in as I mentioned
column6: saying it will be another 25 minutes. With no apologies for the delay or offer for a discount
column7: as well as her not clarifying at all about why there was an additional 20 minutes
column8: giving this place one star for a complete lack of customer service. I get there are delays but a simple sorry goes a long way instead of treating me like I’m a nuisance asking for my paid order. To top it off an employee was eating inside with no mask
column9: before the NJ laws allow for this so if simple COVID Polciy can’t be followed makes wonder what Other sanitary policies are not being followed there ... UPDATE: I was hoping the service would not match the food...was I wrong. Incredibly low quality beef in a tasteless sauce. DO NOT EAT HERE'

author: Golden Sunshine
text:
"Authentic! Surprising in Hoboken!
If you are looking for super trendy  with 5 star service go somewhere else.
If you are looking for authentic food and friendly service go here!
If you gave this less than 5 stars you don't know Malaysian food!
You are not a foodie.
I have not been in a while i have been sick. But we met the owner and hope he is okay!"

author: Andrew Marshall
text: 'had spicy curry soup and sesame chicken was delicious'

author: Henry Kang
text: 'Malaysian Food'

author: Miho Attygalle
text: 'Variety of flavors to enjoy
column5: Malay food is mix of Thai
column6: India and Vietnam cuisine.  I have been coming here over 10 years.'

author: Bobby Adappoor
text: 'Awesome place. Family friendly service. Enjoyed the food.'

author: Rish Agarwal
text: "Decent place. Reducing one star for being a bit too cozy. And also for having dented and scratched glasses for water which feels unclean. But they have straws so that's good.\n\nTry their lo mein
column5:
or egg noodles. Definitely try their appetizers as they are pretty nice.

Overall good food.

One thing I really didnt like is they force u to pay 15-18% gratuity even for small group of 2 or 3. I prefer to tip based on experience and I anyways don't like the tipping culture. 15 to 18% is too high to pay to some1 for just picking bowl of food from a counter 3 feet away to your table. I wish they make it optional.

Carry cash for possibility of a discount."

author: Bobby Adappoor
text: 'Tasty food.'

author: Avinash Garde
text: 'Nice Malaysian eatery!'

author: Chris Bateman
text: "Absolutely absolutely love this place.  The duck trengganu is absolutely incredible and one of the most flavorful dishes I've had in a long time. Another favorite is the Ayam Randang. The staff is friendly and will help you with suggestions from their large menu."

author: Nicholas Liakos
text: 'Roti canai app is amazing we eat it any chance we get'

author: Shae Smalley
text: 'Satay No Way! Waitress was shocking
column5: food may have come from a highway underpass. Not sure if I ate beef or some other animal with only fat and bones. Would not recommend to my least favorite person. My friend’s did appreciate the Diet Coke in a milk shake glass with a curly straw though
column6: so if you’re into that.'

author: My Lam
text: 'Their food is super delicious! Wow
column5: I have never tried Malaysian food before
column6: but this place is super delicious! The prices is reasonable! If you pay cash
column7: you get 10% off! The appetizer is a bit small
column8: but it’s full of flavor and delicious. The entree has a big portion! The food is seasoned very good. The curry noodle soup tasted delicious. And their bbq pork with rice is good
column9: too! I personally recommend try their fried fish with rice. It comes with bell peppers and cashew nuts
column10: super delicious! Their sauce is very different
column11: sweet and sour that goes with the fish and bell peppers. I recommend you to come here and try out their food if you ever stop by Hoboken

author: Ankit Bawa
text: 'Roti Canai and chilli chicken were our favorites. The lunch deal is a great value for money and the restaurant offers a 10% discount if you pay by cash'

author: Arun Warrier
text: 'Good lunch specials available here and a 10 percent discount if you pay by cash'

author: Julian Izzy
text: 'Not my thing. Soups are tasty though'

author: geekandglitter
text: "I ordered the Lamb Saag and the Lamb Rogan Josh. This is quality Indian food
column5: and I've learned there's a big variation from one restaurant to another. I'll be back to this restaurant."

author: Victor Manuel Gonzalez
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent meal!

(Original)
Excelente comida!'

author: Marc Carrillo
text: "Love this place
column5: affordable and tasty! Additionally
column6: you get 10% discount when paying cash.\nI'd definitely recommend it."

author: Warren McLeod
text: 'Great food. Best with a group.'

author: Bhupesh Bora
text: 'Nice Malaysian food but too oily for my teste.'

author: RAJESHKUMAR THANKARAJ
text: 'Awesome food'

author: Ed Moore
text: 'Seems like a locals hang out. Food was tasty but be aware there is no beer
column5: wine or liquor'

author: Kimberly Lindman
text: 'Food is delicious and generous portions.\nNot good if you’re in a rush. In off-peak hours (we were the only customers) waitress was extremely slow to take our order and bring the check. The whole thing took 2 hours
column5: most of it was waiting time.\nWaitress also wanted tip before we got our change back
column6: which we were waiting on so that we *could* tip her.\nWill eat takeout from here
column7: but probably not sit in again.'

author: Cynthia Persaud
text: 'This is my favourite restaurant! Amazing food and amazing service.'

author: dru kapadia
text: "Not sure how authentic but I enjoyed it. Won't leave hungry."

author: ankana bhatacharya
text: 'Stale food and bad service
column5: particularly found them rude when we tried to sort our our bill. There was confusion around the food served and I requested for some curry since the chicken CURRY I ordered was particularly dry. Still trying to understand what "dry curry" is! Not coming back 😒'

author: Prashant Naik
text: 'Food is stale dint like the service. Very rude waiters.'

author: rohan mehra
text:
'Extremely bad service and food.

What kind of dish is Dry Curry? The food was stale and the Roti was completely overcooked and Crispy like a Cracker. On top of it the Manager kept fighting with us.

Not worth coming back here.'

author: Niki Mishra
text: "Just like every good restaurant that loses its charm after sometime
column5: Satay has gone down the drain. It's very sad to see the standards go down in this restaurant. It was our favorite go to place. We were served cold stale food- it's not even hygienic!!! I would not recommend this place anymore
column6: it was really good."

author: Priyanka Ramesh
text: 'AMAZING! So so so delicious. Just wow! They just have great food and really friendly staff. We will be coming back again and again.'

author: luis guaman
text: 'Nice good food 👍'

author: Nan Xiang
text: 'The Malay fried noodles & rice noodles (马来炒米面but I forgot the exact English name) was soooo good! It tasted like what you would have in a hawker center in Malaysia or Singapore. The lunch special was very affordable. Wish I can visit again!'

author: Emily Wong
text: 'Love this place. Food is always great and consistent. They also have a pretty sweet deal for lunch.'

author: rajkumar PARDASANI
text: 'Fantastic food.  Good service.  If u pay cash u get 10% discount !'

author: Jitesh Chulani
text: 'Good food and reasonable price. The service is not that great. The host will rush you up to finish quickly. Also
column5: the walk in customers keep hovering inside while people eat.\nThey have to make the customers aware of the wait time rather than asking sitting customers to hurry up. Never heard of that . Bad customer service'

author: Allan Lazenby
text: 'This is one of my favorite lunch spots. Good vegetarian food at a great price.'

author: Alex McCabe
text: 'Their satay was surprisingly mediocre given their name. Their nasi goreng was on point though. Order that.'

author: Clifford A Rathkopf Jr.
text: 'Very good
column5: authentic Malay cuisine.  Sambal blachang (sp) was just a Chinese hot sauce
column6: however.  Pleasant surroundings
column9: and 10 percent discount for cash payment.  How do I have any idea about the food??  Married in KL

author: matthew blum
text: 'Delicious 🤤'

author: rahul ajit
text: "It's authentic Malaysian food
column5: yummy!"

author: Rushikesh Javalgekar
text: 'Amazing food.. Must eat'

author: Jeanne Watkins
text: 'Delicious food! Excellent service.'

author: Samrat Baweja
text: 'Good food!'

author: Deepan Guharajan
text: "Nice shop with a lunch special you can't miss!! This meal with choice of rice and soup
column5: all for $8.75! Nice server who take care of us as well.  Nice decor as well. PS
column6: ask for the chilli oil

author: Arcelia Gallardo
text: 'Great Shrimp steamed dumplings
column5: egg noodles
column6: mango sticky rice. Didn’t care for the deep fried tofu with bamboo and cucumber- was dry and tasteless.'

author: Sara Wu
text: 'Really good food!'

author: Lin W.
text: 'Good portions!  Tasty! Will come back again.'

author: S.-S. Cheung
text: 'Very tasty and authentic Malaysian food.'
